intro: Sida uniaristata, commonly known as the narrowleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, disturbed areas and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Sida uniaristata is an annual herb that produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous small seeds.
